snippet: This Norwegian pianist opened with a selection of seldom-heard Sibelius pieces, then moved on to Beethoven, Debussy and Chopin.
abstract: Anthony Tommasini reviews solo recital by pianist Leif Ove Andsnes at Carnegie Hall.
lead_paragraph: This Norwegian pianist opened with a selection of seldom-heard Sibelius pieces, then moved on to Beethoven, Debussy and Chopin.

headline.main: Review: Leif Ove Andsnes Gives a Thoughtful Recital at Carnegie Hall
